process.name: BP CSM/101 - Change Impact Assessment Process

target.name: NCHQ
TLM
WAA
SAA
EAA
Design Change Owner (DCO)
WTA
STA
Other

phases.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: Start
01. Design Change owner completes section A1 of CIAP form
02. Sign CIAP to confirm validity of change
03. Complete section A2 of CIAP form
04. Sign off CIAP section A2
05. If a Trial is required complete section A3 of CIAP form.
06. Validation checks conducted
07. Is the CIAP form ready for submission to the Sentencing Committee?
08. Sentencing committee categorises change, assigns priority and determines level of evidence required.  Acceptance plan considered, Section B1 of sentencing committee is completed.
09. Is a CCU required?
10. Initiate CCU
11. Is the change considered simple or complex?

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 12. Does CIAP form contain sufficient evidence to proceed immediately?

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 13. CIAP form signed and decision noted.

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 14. Compile list of technical stakeholders.

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 15. Compile list of pan-Defence Line of Development (DLOD) stakeholders.

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 16. Undertake stakeholder review of CIAP.

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 17. Collate Stakeholder responses to CIAP information.

phase.name: Stage 1.2 Evidence preparation and stakeholder engagement

steps.name: 18. Have any stakeholder queries been received?
19. Design Change Owner addresses stakeholder queries
20. Design Change Owner builds portfolio of evidence.
21. Responses to Stakeholder queries approved as closed.
22. Design Change Owner submits CIAP portfolio to SAA.
23. Validation checks conducted on completed CIAP portfolio.
24. Decision taken as to whether the CIAP application is ready for submission to the Approval Committee.
25. Sufficient evidence to allow implementation?
26. Is this a high priority change which must be completed outside of standard timeframes?
27.  Operating Duty Holder (ODH) Review.
28. CIAP approved. Sign section D1 of CIAP form.
29. Is this a fleet trial?
30. Sign section D2 and D3 of CIAP form.
31. Collate and archive evidence set.
32. Initiate Safety Assessment
33. Does the Concept Installation Design need to be updated post impact assessment?
34. Co-ordinate additional technical support.
35. Confirm that the equipment support solution is in place for the equipment to be fitted.\t
36. Review of the ILS plan at the Platform/Class Level.
37. Ensure that the procurement strategy for any outstanding equipment requirements has been considered.
38. Statement of Requirement generated for change if required.
39. Cost estimate refined against Statement of Requirement.
40. Draft Initial Fit Plan and Design Change Project Plan.
41. Obtain commercial approval for the change.
42. Obtain financial approval for the change.
43. Proceed with development of the design change?
44. Sponsor notified.
45. Design Change Approved to proceed.
46. Provide feedback to the DCO
47. Proceed with change.
48. Compile LFE.
End
